BIO

Amanda is a multi-talented web developer, designer, programmer, and project manager with a passion for creating beautiful and functional websites. She has a strong eye for design and a deep understanding of coding languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, allowing her to create stunning visual experiences that are also highly responsive and user-friendly. Her skills in project management enable her to effectively lead teams and ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.

2019 - Current

Company ABC

Agile Scrum Master

expert in agile project management, having led teams through the development of many successful projects. She is skilled in using tools such as Trello, Asana and Jira to effectively coordinate and manage team members, track progress, and ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.

2015 - 2019

Company DEF

Full Stack Developer | UI Designer

Developing and maintaining the entire web application, from the client-side to the server-side, and ensuring that all components work together seamlessly. Designing and implementing the database schema and ensuring that the data is properly stored and retrieved. Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code. Integrating the application with third-party services and APIs. Collaborating with other team members, including designers, project managers, and other developers, to create and deliver high-quality web applications.

2012 - 2015

Company GHI

Front End Developer

Designing and developing user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Creating and implementing responsive designs that work well on different screen sizes and resolutions. Developing interactive and dynamic user interfaces using JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, and Vue.js. Collaborating with other team members, including designers, project managers, and back-end developers, to ensure that the application is visually appealing, user-friendly, and accessible. Utilizing design tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, and Figma to create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes of the UI.
